intro: Richardia astroites, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and somewhat succulent. Richardia astroites typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks.
